summary: The document is a classified communication detailing the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) meetings with KGB officials in Minsk, focusing on the assassination of President John F. Kennedy and Lee Harvey Oswald's time in Minsk. It highlights the necessity of a legal review prior to arranging meetings between the ARRB and KGB, stressing the importance of not engaging in substantive discussions. The document enumerates the KGB officials encountered by ARRB members in October 1996, detailing their roles and personal identifiers, and concludes with specifics regarding file and authorization details.
key_findings: Facilitation of meetings between the ARRB and KGB officials concerning the JFK assassination.
Emphasis on legal review and abstention from substantive discussions.
Inclusion of details about KGB officials met by ARRB members in October 1996, such as their roles and identifying information.
Document classification as 'SECRET' with comprehensive file and authorization details.
